content.description:
Follow flakes and slabs up and slightly left to the first button head bolt. After a move or two you can fish in some small gear (it was a C3 of some variety if I remember correctly). From there move up to the second button head and move up and right (crux) to a good stance. Clip the 3rd button head and slab climb up and left to another flake where you can place a piece, move up to the last button head followed by another couple 5.8 moves to the summit slings. The moves to the summit feel exposed to this weenie climber, maybe because it feels like it kicks back a bit and you are a little ways above your last "bolt". 

  I'm not sure how much this thing gets climbed but you would likely want to bring some slings to wrap around the summit just in case they need to be replaced.
content.protection: 4 old button head bolts and a few small cams.
content.location: Located on the south east face of the Moving Finger formation.

content.description: Climb a wide chimney under a large chock stone.  Move up and to the right to a belay ledge with slings.  The summit block is cracked so be careful if you decide to climb up it.  It must be down climbed back to the belay ledge.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Webbing to rap off of.  Replace as needed.
content.location: The route is in the gully between Rubaiyat Spire and Tower of Darkness/Shaft of Light/Moving Finger.  Look for a wide crack with a large chock stone on your left as you hike up the gully.

content.description: Moving Finger is on the south end of the Spire 2 ridge.
